docs.title: Welcome to my Erotic Hypnosis Beginner listener's guide
docs.text:
Thanks for taking the time to check out this site! Hope it helps!

If you're very new to hypnosis, you should check out Start Here

If you've got some experience with hypnosis, you may still find something useful here!

docs.title: HypnoDB
docs.text: HypnoDB has a fairly large list of files and their descriptions. if you're uncertian about a file's contents,or can't find the file description, you can check here and

docs.title: Temi
docs.text: Temi is an audio transcription service that offers a free trial for audio files under 45 minutes.

docs.title: TempMail
docs.text: TempMail is a free service that lets you make a temporary e-mail address, when paired wit Temi, you can transcribe as many audio files as you like.

docs.title: Erotic Hypnosis Subreddit
docs.text: The Erotic Hypnosis Subreddit is a good community to explore, it has many members who actively create scripts and shorter erotic hypnos.

docs.title: Gone Wild Audio Subreddit
docs.text: The Gone Wild Audio Subredditis like the Erotic Hypnosis Subreddit, but a bit kinkier. I would say the audios are less geared towards hypnosis though.

docs.title: Early Listening Recommendations
docs.text: Here I will list out some Hypnotists that I believe are fairly beginner friendly, as well as file recommendations.

docs.title: Fiona Clearwater
docs.text: I'd highly reccomend if you're brand new to hypnosis, you start with Fiona. She lays out what to expect at the start of each of her files, so you're not blindsided by anything.

docs.title: Extra Deep Hypnosis With Fiona Clearwater
docs.text: This file is designed to take you into a very deep trance and make it easier for you to go into deep trances in the future.

docs.title: Clicker Fractionation Hypnosis
docs.text: In this file Fiona uses a clicker to trigger you to go in and out of hypnosis.

docs.title: Nikki Fatale
docs.text: I've not had a chance to listen to many of her files, but from my research her files are very friendly to newcomers

docs.title: Because series
docs.text: This series is focused on going into a deep trance.

docs.title: Focused Relaxation
docs.text: Fun little videos designed to help you relax into a trance, very safe for beginners. The videos are typically focused around a part of her body or an object. I don't have any specific reccomendations for her flies, as they're all good starting points. If you're struggling to pick one to start with, I'd reccomend one that has an induction.

docs.title: Hypnosis and You
docs.text: Welcome to the guide! Before we even start talking about hypnosis, there are a few points we should cover.

docs.title: Mental Health and Hypnosis
docs.text:
Hypnosis is best enjoyed with a calm mind clear of any distractions. If you have a metal condition, consider asking your psychologist or doctor if hypnosis is right for you. Hypnosis can be espically dangerous if you have a multiple personality disorder or a dissociative identidy disorder.

Before listening to hypnosis, you should do a bit of research about what you're about to listen to, and who created it. Vetting a file you're going to listen to is a very good practice to develop for new listeners. Once you get some experience with a creator and their files, then you can consider going in blind.

Before listening to hypnosis, you should take care of any obligations, like cooking yourself a meal, hydrating yourself, going to the bathroom, or talking to a loved one.

I have no experience with using substances with hypnosis. I would say that you shouldn't need anything to expierence hypnosis, but everyone is different.

Remember, hypnosis can't make you do something that is absolutely against your moral code. However, it can help unlock facets of your personality you didn't know you had.

If you're not enjoying a file, you can turn it off at any time. It's easy for the mind to shut off a stimuli when feeling disgust. Like how you pinch your nose when you smell garbage, except it's you taking off your headset when you hear something you don't like.

docs.title: Trance
docs.text: A relaxed, yet sharply focused state of mind.

docs.title: Neuro-Linguistic Programming
docs.text: A form of communication that aims to change behavioral patterns, proven a pseudoscience though.

docs.title: Fractionation
docs.text: The act of taking the subject out of trance, then dropping them back down deeper.

docs.title: Storytelling
docs.text: The hypnotist weaves a story of a character that you can identify with, and potentially self insert into.

docs.title: Subliminals
docs.text: Subliminals are things that the concious mind isn't supposed to pick up, and are designed to go straight to the subconcious mind.

docs.title: Learning to trance
docs.text:
Before listening to hypnosis, you should learn to trance. Meditation is a great first step on learning to trance, as you're learning to just focus on your self and your breathing.

Yoga can also be helpful while learning to trance. Most hypnosis files involve you staying stil for an extended period of time, which may lead to cramping. Getting a cramp while under and getting rudely pulled out of trance by something like a charlie horse is not an enjoyable experience. Stretching hypnosis will also improve blood flow.

Doing breathing exercises is also beneficial.

docs.title: Core concepts from this page
docs.text:
• Stretch and relax before hypnosis.
  • Take care of prior obligations before listening.
  • Don't get discouraged if you don't see instant results.
  • You can stop at anytime.
  • Have Fun!
